## CES-D vs PSS-10

A common challenge in psychology and social science research is the comparison and valid interpretation of results obtained from different questionnaire measures. In this case, researchers often look at integrative measures such as the CES-D and PSS-10. The CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression) questionnaire assesses symptomatology associated with depression, while the PSS-10 (Perceived Stress Scale, 10-item version) measures perceived stress, with some overlap in construct measured.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and PSS-10

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#__In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJIYXZlIHlvdSBiZWVuIGFuZ2VyZWQgYmVjYXVzZSBvZiB0aGluZ3MgdGhhdCB3ZXJlIG91dHNpZGUgb2YgeW91ciBjb250cm9sPyJ9LCB7InF1ZXN0aW9uX3RleHQiOiAiSGF2ZSB5b3UgZmVsdCBkaWZmaWN1bHRpZXMgd2VyZSBwaWxpbmcgdXAgc28gaGlnaCB0aGF0IHlvdSBjb3VsZCBub3Qgb3ZlcmNvbWUgdGhlbT8ifV19XQ==" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and PSS-10 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#__In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJIYXZlIHlvdSBiZWVuIGFuZ2VyZWQgYmVjYXVzZSBvZiB0aGluZ3MgdGhhdCB3ZXJlIG91dHNpZGUgb2YgeW91ciBjb250cm9sPyJ9LCB7InF1ZXN0aW9uX3RleHQiOiAiSGF2ZSB5b3UgZmVsdCBkaWZmaWN1bHRpZXMgd2VyZSBwaWxpbmcgdXAgc28gaGlnaCB0aGF0IHlvdSBjb3VsZCBub3Qgb3ZlcmNvbWUgdGhlbT8ifV19XQ==" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#__In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJIYXZlIHlvdSBiZWVuIGFuZ2VyZWQgYmVjYXVzZSBvZiB0aGluZ3MgdGhhdCB3ZXJlIG91dHNpZGUgb2YgeW91ciBjb250cm9sPyJ9LCB7InF1ZXN0aW9uX3RleHQiOiAiSGF2ZSB5b3UgZmVsdCBkaWZmaWN1bHRpZXMgd2VyZSBwaWxpbmcgdXAgc28gaGlnaCB0aGF0IHlvdSBjb3VsZCBub3Qgb3ZlcmNvbWUgdGhlbT8ifV19XQ==" target="harmonyapp">Import just PSS-10 into Harmony</a> - compare PSS-10 with other instruments
* [See CES-D in PDF](https://nida.nih.gov/sites/default/files/Mental_HealthV.pdf)


The CES-D vs PSS-10 comparison therefore requires careful harmonisation to ensure valid conclusions. Harmony is a software dedicated to facilitating this harmonisation process. With its advanced natural language processing and AI modelling, Harmony can swiftly compare each item in the CES-D and PSS-10, generating a percentage-match result. This vastly reduces the time-consuming work often necessary in manual comparison and interpretation.

In the case of CES-D vs PSS-10, Harmony also offers the possibility of comparing these instruments in multiple languages - a feature that can be particularly useful in international and multi-cultural studies. We recommend researchers undertaking CES-D vs PSS-10 comparison to make use of Harmony for streamlined, objective and accurate results. Not only can you select from Harmony's extensive database, but you can also upload your own instruments in PDF format directly into the Harmony's web interface. Considering the significant benefits offered, Harmony carves the path to a more efficient and effective harmonisation for researchers comparing CES-D and PSS-10.
